cxoMHE-yoebkjClqfn4__w.text: Very good authentic Turkish food. Great service, very friendly stuff. Pleasant experience with friends. They have Turkish baklava, tea and origin Turkish coffee!

Bs_ECTX-aIHtRxVKl9wTJw.text: The food at this establishment is so good it's ridiculous!  I would not be able to come up with a single complaint except maybe it's not close enough to where we live.  I came in with my husband and 2 daughters.  The waitress greeted us the minute we stepped in the door and luckily she was our waitress for the night.  She was formal (like they are in fancy restaurants)  but not one bit stuffy.  She helped us with ordering (the kebobs are to die for! as is the sampler plate!)  The presentation was along the lines of a 4 star restaurant.  She brought us complimentary Turkish tea at the conclusion of our meal which was wonderful!  We will definitely go back again.  I also think this would make a great event restaurant as they offer platters for 8 or more people.  Prices are very reasonable for what you get!

Bls54rMGhqR23p_0SszF7A.text: Very delicious Mediterranean food.It was my first time trying this type of food, I found it very addictive! Good shrimp, chicken grill with fresh salad. Nice waitress too!

jbtimY50scVhbcem5dYooQ.text: The food was delicious and service was exceptional. Our server, Leyla, was very helpful and super nice. We tried Kebap and it was well done. We will definitely stop by here whenever we are in town.

vPrS6RxLWed-50dKZvt5tQ.text: Delicious food!! Need I say more?  The staff are professional and friendly.  The portions are very large for the price point - go in hungry and you will still come out with leftovers.  Definitely a gem in the rough!  I would recommend it to friends, as well as come back next time I am in Vegas!!

lfpOIFlZYr2tFcXCzOPJxw.text: Just finished a wonderful dinner here!  Never had Turkish food before.  Will be coming back soon!  The Kuru Fasulye a white bean and chopped lamb dish was delightful.   The Lentil soup was velvety smooth and seasoned perfectly.   Turkish baklava is softer and chewier than most others, not overly sweet.  MUST have the Turkish coffee with it!   Awesome.   Staff was friendly and welcoming.   I highly recommend it.  Like a mini Mediterranean vaca!

aV4LQ9pHjOq3dpdQI9D2Uw.text: Been here several times and I like this place more and more each time. Foods seems to be getting better and better each time and service is always exceptional. Never crowded and each waitress has been extremely nice and attentive. The pita bread app comes out warm and tasty and the hummus is so good. We have been to several Mediterranean restaurants in town and Maza makes the best chicken kabobs, marinated so tasty and juicy and cooked just right. Had the chicken wrap (sandwich) once and that was really good too. They have groupon and coupons in the flyers for 1/2 off an entree or $5 off or free Baklava dessert and they always take both the $5 and give the free baklava too, bonus! Plus they give you free Turkish hot tea at end too which is tasty. No complaints except they stop taking restaurant.com certificates for some reason and I still had one (never expire). They were nice and apologetic about it but still was a disappointment. Fortunately restaurant.com is great about exchanging unused certificates for new ones. Decor is very nice (upscale) and prices are reasonable.

o0NylmmtKQWmSdplJHDjWw.text: food was decent and service was great! friendly staff and good pricing (-: first time at a greek restuarant, i wouldnt mind coming back.

ltJUuNS2B1cvYTGez0hyCw.text: Went for lunch yesterday at 1:45 p.m. Sadly, the worst we've had in Las Vegas. Started with the lenal soup which was horrible. Tasted like canned Cambell's soup with maybe puree'd lentles ... not sure it was pretty bland. No flavor. Wife's Greek salad was just ... meh, okay. Nothing remarkable, can get this anywhere. I had a Gyro sandwich which was cold, not warm. Cold. I believe it should have been warm. It was served with 3 canned pickles on a plate with a small plastic container with an ounce of thousand island salad dressing. Maybe for the limp fries. Greek? I don't think so. The reviews all show decent. Umm ... not even close. Maybe the business does this to generate interest. The owner was there I think. He was courteous to all the middle eastern patrons but us white people he avoided even a welcome. All I know is what tastes good. In a competitive market, quality and at least feeling appreciated as a customer goes a long way. Yes, there are lot's of great choices in Las Vegas so sadly, avoid this place. There are much, much, much, much better restaurants for equal or cheaper prices. We've been to Paymon's up on Sahara at Durango, it was by far better with great customer service.

0GWGYs3a0UeatE-OnldkvQ.text: Combo chicken & beef.... Food was flavorful but something was missing I don't know what it is????  I got it the portion was wayyyy to small for the price.

I0792UrbLcGDBhoaOdSGFA.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would!!!! Always so good and consistent. The food is ahhhmazing and the staff are great too. Chicken kabob, sultans delight, lentil soup, and the rice pudding are the best things to order here.

l568H6SwOQEz7Sl5BSG-8w.text: I absolutely LOVED this place! Today was my first time visiting and the waiter (a very tall handsome male),treated me and [my] family as though we were [his] family The women there are exceptional cooks for starters and we pretty much sampled everything from appetizers down to the ice cream & Turkish coffee. I must admit,there was absolutely nothing  to complain about! Unless of course you're that negative bitter lonely individual who enjoys putting others down or simply finding trivial reasons to be unhappy. I highly recommend this place and will be returning soon for that good ole baklava

0FNsrfEBlHcTgV1SiJ7XDA.text: Food:  High quality, colorful ingredients!  Very tasty!  True to the Turkish /Middle Eastern culture! Great attention to detail w the preparation of the foods... Salad was so beautiful and yummy, the kabobs... I could eat them everyday w their Medi Salad  The Ezme was very yummy... tomatoes & pepper paste... looks like a reddish hummus... no chickpeas here  The Sultan Delight was a very light portion of Lamb layered over baba ghanoush...  Oh, lovely Sarma, how yummy you are!!! Have them if you love grape leaves (Vegetarian) Turkish coffee & warm baklava... Yum!  Service: Very pleasant staff! Alexandrina was very sweet and attentive. .. she made sure we were taken care of and that we were enjoying our food... even offered suggestions & accompaniments...  Ambience: Local strip mall location... the old Opa! Not bad at all... the interior is simply decorated w their lovely Turkish lamps  Small dance floor area for future live entertainment No liquor license as of this date...  Overall, our dining experience was a very satisfying one... We will definitely return!  Thank you to the Chef for such a wonderful Epicurean experience!   Thank you, Alex! We will see you soon!  Your constant companion,   ~deirdra

Jm3eFt-cX3Q7MTBCQIDzLg.text: We have been here a number of times over the last few years.  It has gone from good to fair at best.  Salad was good but Beef Doner was chips of meat over rice with another salad and red cabbage.  No peppers or such as pictured.  The food was barely warm and lacked flavor as I had to use the sauce to season the food.   Service was ok..friendly but clumbsy and I almost poked her with the fork as she reached on my plate to remove something.  Having been to Turkey and this lacks originality and overall disappointing.  Sorry but won't return...not worth the drive to have a fair experience and average food.

8AxjXIGoIOJDq147YZNWOw.text: Let me start with how hungry I was when I went to Maza to eat with my wife. The server came up to us and asked what we wanted. I ordered a beef kabob and my wife ordered a chicken kabob. I also asked for the vegetable kebab. 15 minutes passes and the served comes up and says, "Sorry, we don't have eggplant for the vegetable kabob, do you want it ?" We said No since there is no point of ordering a vegetable kabob with no eggplant. So we waited and approximately 25-30 minutes later the server brings us a Chicken kabob plate for my wife. My wife did not start eating and just waited for my plate. Approximately 35 minutes later I ask the served how much longer do I have to wait for my beef kabob. The server says" its $9.95 and about 10 minutes." I told him that I don't care about the price and just wanted to know how long do I have to wait for my plate and he replied, "you didn't order anything." I told him that the first thing came out of my mouth was a beef kabob and he had that stupid look on his face. The server was from Serbia and his english was not good to understand I guess what we ordered. Let me tell you how the dirty that place was all kind of dust on the floor and chairs. The service was horrible, I asked for napkins and refill for my soda. My wife and I ended up splitting the chicken and it tasted bad, besides the portion was very small. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands prior to ordering and it smelled really bad. Try other places in town and don't waste your money please. I promise you will be disappointedworst restaurant in town.

qkE57YjDrgOcunSoek2tCw.text: Ordered take-out for dinner last night. I got the Kofte entree and some hummus. I tasted the hummus first. Was pretty good. Not The best, but definitely better than most. Had to set it aside because I knew it would fill me up too fast, and I had a whole container of Kofte to tackle. It was awesome. Killed it off-all of it. Well most of it. The hot pepper on the side really kicked my ass, but everything else was good. The salad may have been a little peppery. No big deal. Need to end this review. I have some left-over hummus to eat.

m00OfQLguWNTNlvNHG0a8g.text: My husband, daughter, and I came here on a whim but were pleasantly surprised by the great selection, friendly staff, and mellow atmosphere.   We ordered the Cacik and Falafel with pita and hummus for our appetizers, and Karniyarik and Kofte for the entrees.  The kofte came with a delicious salad that had a vinegar/lemon flavor. The kofte and falafel were just right (not dry) and all the food had the right amount seasoning.    It looks like they might have nightly entertainment, but we were a bit early for any of the festivities. We'll definitely be back.

YX-8S609nl8p_OD0ULF7Iw.text: I came here to introduce a friend to Turkish food and the experience was wonderful. We started with Baba Ganoush appetizer, delicious.   Our main courses were Kabobs, 1 Shish and the other Adana and both were good but slightly less spicy that I've experienced before, still good. We ended with Kunefe dessert which was  an interesting change. The staff were very accommodating and let us try a few other items. I will definitely go back and refer many friends to try Maza also.

Ao15pbCtZyGPurRZe95s_Q.text: I was pleased with my experience here.  The food is good, it is priced well, and the service is good.  Honestly, the baba ghanoush is probably some of the best I've ever had, but the hummus was less than fantastic.  However, the rest of the food more than made ip for it.  Our waitress, whose name escapes me, was very attentive and gave good recommendations for us.    I had the chicken shawurma with fries.  Everything was hot and fresh.  As mentioned by other reviewers, the french fries are fantastic, hot, crispy, and seasoned to perfection.  We ate ourselves sick.  Definitely going to return.

lwvbRHFP0lDPRg4nOHFm2A.text: This is my favorite new Mediterranean restaurant.  The food was excellent, the prices are very reasonable, and the service was great!  I had the Maza Beyti Kebab & it was awesome!  The hummus was also very good.  My wife & I will definitely be going back soon to try more of the menu.

_oiy2I9i6bPO55c4intMJA.text: Very clean very good customer service. Very delicious food and very quick service...  They get  great Kinda and I love it

-VcQGUzbRUtXpEAKaHbDHw.text: Wow, we ate here last night for the first time last night and we are STILL talking about it! The food was perfect in every way and the prices are very reasonable.  We ordered: Cheese plate appetizer - sliced moist Bulgarian feta with piles of fresh herbs like                                          Basil, dill, mint, and also some green onions Sampler Appetizer - hummus, baba ganoush, tabbouleh, and dolmas Chicken kebab Veggie kebab Combo kebab Beef shwarma  The appetizers were delicious. I was especially impressed with the giant piles of fresh herbs served with the yummy Bulgarian feta on the cheese plate.  American feta is more on the dry and crumbly side, so we appreciate restaurants that serve the moist and creamy Bulgarian type. This place got my honey to try mint and dill leaves for the first time too, and he enjoyed it! Score! The sampler appetizer was  fantastic. We enjoyed the hummus and dolmas, and I was hooked on the tabbouleh salad. Baba ganoush was yummy too.  On to the main course....  We each ordered kebabs. Every thing we ordered was seasoned perfectly and was served beautifully on the plates. All of the meat and veggies were grilled with skill as they were so moist. The grilled veggies had the perfect amount of charring on them. All dinners come with some grilled veggies (tomato, onions, and jalapeno), jasmine rice or fries, and a salad. We each had salad and rice. Salad was delicious and had a unique dressing. It was light with good flavor and we enjoyed it. The jasmine rice was amazing. I  usually forego the carby side dishes, but I couldn't keep my fork out of this rice....super yum!!!  It's worth noting this places does not have a liquor license. However, don't let that be a deal breaker for you, as you can BYOB. We will be doing that for beer and wine next time. There is also a convenience store in the same parking lot you can run into to in case you forget.    We ordered so much food my only regret was not saving room for dessert. I'm not really worried....as we can wait to go back!!!

dwNf8icN-0TaBHFDAndZ3A.text: What a great place! I loved the atmosphere, service, and the cuisine. The fully pictured menu makes your mouth water and the mood is set to dine and dance at the same time. Thank you Ms. Anna for being so professional and delightful. Everyone should stop in and enjoy!

jSXKoXJckSGfGxOGSHfEXA.text: This place is about the only place that makes their babaganoush on the chunky side. At most places it comes out looking just like hummus...and it's not very good. Theirs could be better but it's still good as were the rest of the items on the Maza sampler (+hummus, tabouleh, & sarma).   We also ended up with the Seafood Kabob (we tried to cancel this & swap for the Maza sampler but the waitress cancelled our other order). Which was just as well because it was surprisingly good. The shrimp was well cooked and seasoned and tasted great with this (I think) tomato based sauce). The salmon, which I'm sure was Altantic farmed, actually tasted pretty salmony which is hardly ever the case with farmed raised salmon because it's awful.   I don't recommend the Turkish coffee. Despite waiting for the grinds to settle some fine pieces remained suspended so it always tasted a little gritty and wasn't very strong.   I looks like they've got a stage and some sweet light action so I'm not sure if this place blows up at night. We went for lunch at 11:30 on a Saturday and we were the only people in there until another couple eventually came along.

N8l3rkuMCV84Ts2_UXQpgw.text: Great kebabs and I love the mediterranean salad. Don't miss out on the baklava either!  Service is very good as well. Definitely put this place on your list.

o3Omg9u5fPjW1RUQX_0qAA.text: The food was amazing. The servers were prompt and courteous. Wait time for foot was very fast. We went and tried for a Groupon and found this gem. It's definitely a delicious place with a chill atmosphere for or all

y3M-kB6cjvmQYuAZYLw2Pg.text: This was the first time I'd been to a Turkish restaurant and the experience was amazing!!!!!! First of all the ambience was very welcoming as soon as we entered.. We were then greeted by a very nice and polite waitress who was very patient with us while we asked her a zillion questions about the menu.. Food came out pretty fast and OMG so tasty... I would definitely recommend this restaurant.. The portions are very fair for the price.. And the owner was very attentive of all the tables.. He made sure we were comfortable, got our food fast, was super friendly and even walked us out after we were done.. But the best part was their bakhlava.. (Request them to warm it up instead of having it cold.. It will add to the taste).. This was by far the best bakhlava I've ever had.. The owner said that his sister makes them fresh which is why they taste good and pretty much homemade..

kRlt3Socz0gGQlTCKo4yZQ.text: Good portion, great price and nice staff. We love the Chicken kabob and shawarmas, melts in your mouth.

Tw6Hjp4CnBSzgRDrNEkOMw.text: " You know when you go to a restaurant and the service is good, but the food is not quite good? There comes a point when the manager comes to you and asks you about the service and the food and their just so nice that you have to lie about the food being good. But service is great. Well ladies and gentlemen you don't have to worry about that here at Maza Grill the food is fantastic!! Hands down, hummus here phenomenal!"

ktirVokSb6G6h4GndGJKqA.text: It's Turkish cuisine but definitely not Turkish prepared. Service was great and our server was knowledgeable but food is far from "best Turkish food" as it states.

A89wWyDvrDjC9FibLsLsqA.text: I needed a lunch spot in this area and turned to Yelp for recommendations. I went on a recent Wednesday afternoon at noon. I walked in and another guy walked in at the same time. It was empty and there was no one in the entry. We waited and waited. Finally, a young lady came out and offered to help us. When I told her I needed a table for two, she told me to sit wherever I wanted. If that's the case, then why don't you just have a sign that says "Please seat yourself"?  Instead I had just been standing in the entry like a fool.  My lunch companion arrived shortly thereafter. We haven't seen each other in years so we spent some time catching up.  The server did come by a couple of times, but we were never ready. Then she disappeared. It wasn't busy but she was the only person I saw working. Also, because she let people seat themselves, the few tables were in different corners, which didn't make a lot of sense. Finally we flagged her down. We both ordered salads, which took way too long to come out. I had the Mediterranean salad with chicken and my friend had the Greek salad with salmon. The salad was tasty, but nothing amazing. It did have a lot of dill in it. Once again it was time to wait for the server to pick up our plates and give us our check. Took quite a while once again. All in all, I was there about 2 hours for a salad.  I probably won't go back. I don't live anywhere near this place and there was nothing really compelling to get me to go back.

r_ro8SkHGeZttqrF22jvYg.text: (Ordered online, so I don't actually know anything about the physical restaurant.)  The baklava was absolutely divine. It was so sweet and flaky, the flavor is just incredible. The gyro sandwich was a little disappointing. The meat was burnt and a bit too oily. The lamb kabob entree was very good. The lamb meat was excellent, it really complimented well with the rice, pita bread, and salad (the only mediocre portion out of the whole entree).   Overall a bit pricy, but delicious.

D5bwKvF7V60RilNygofolw.text: Not real good.  Ordered a gyro with fries and tabouli.  Gyro meat tasted old and tabouli wasn't much better.  Won't be back with so many great choices, one is right down the street on Sahara.

3mp-vzXY-JMxp3saq4veFw.text: Very good food. Very attentive service. I've been in twice and got take out once. Each time has been consistently good.

favzomzhhr6ecQZmK8Jtng.text: My wife and I went with friends on a Groupon and didn't know exactly what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised! The restaurant is one large room with tables and a few booths all decked out with white linen and butcher...definite Mediterranean feel. The tapas were excellent - I suggest getting the combo. The meals were varied and well priced. Exceptional flavors! We were all very impressed. We will definitely be going back!

7Ah5rX1qkwD2u8iDoJX46w.text: The food is sooooo goood! The chicken, lamb and beef are all so tender and just melt in your mouth. I have never had Mediterranean food in Vegas which was this good before. We also had the seafood platter, again very tasty. I would definitely recommend the rack of lamb, although what my friends got was also very very good! I will definitely come back here! Their baklava is just superb. The owner told us that it is home made. No wonder it tasted so much better than the baklava that you get at other places. Definitely the best baklava I have had in my life so far. Give it a try, I am pretty sure you won't be disappointed.

ooQDvbZk03S1L74zPeEGMA.text: The food here was Awesome! I tried something new while I was here and it was delicious. I was not a fan of the salad that came with the meal but just too much food for me! Hummus and Bread was amazing!

4mNcP3bxECvysuLI0jnbLA.text: "Racks on racks" That rack of lamb tho, is a must... Seasoned with precision. Hummus is a go-to for any meddi spot. Salmon kabob was crisp and succulent, good when u and beef need some time to "meet other proteins." Rice for the entrees was on point, like Stockton to Malone. Overall pretty good, flava u can savor.

l1s-IOrh5unxgl_yaI02Kg.text: This place is amazing Mediteranenan like what we found in Istanbul Turkey. Don't order another gyro, try try the real stuff like ground beef stuffed eggplant with rice pilaf and taziki. Amazing!!!!

qh6hmee3QnEdmoYWWiNG7A.text: Place was really good. I went for lunch there and it was just the best! enjoyed the food my favorite appetizer was the flat bread and hummus!!! the food was delicious. you guys must try!!!

9t055BDb_uFIc4-Nfb-ajA.text: Update: My wait time extended up to 43 minutes and if i hadn't asked the only person to ever check on me for a refund had they put my order together. After another 5 minutes of waiting, i finally got my order and the guy told me they had added a complimentary dessert and they won't be charging me the gratuity that i initially added to my bill. He also informed me that it took that long for the order to prepare because they were also preparing for a very large banquet(it would've been nice if they told me that from the get go). As far as the food go, I gave it a 3-star overall. Portions are plenty on all the orders, and they all tasted great. I would've rated this place higher if not for the long wait. Came in and the place is empty. I ordered a take out and was told wait time is about 20 minutes( i was the only customer). I'm typing this review after 38 minutes sitting in the front and still no sign of my food being ready. I ordered 2 chicken shawarma and 2 chicken adana and a knefe. I will update this review if food is worth the wait.

gFuCQG1od7GB0TbvxxQ2JA.text: Great restaurant!  I love the food and atmosphere.  The service can get A LOT better in my opinion.  That's why it is 4 star from me.

kRDJxja4E1sM6xuv6yn69Q.text: Clean and very friendly staff. Very quite for dinner time, felt like the whole place is ours, and 2 other tables.  The kebabs were delicious, especially the beef kebab. Lots of meat and grilled perfectly to your liking. Lamb shank also looked good, my friend says it's good.  I don't eat lamb so can't judge myself.   The salad was what draws me here from other Yelp photos, but unfortunately they don't look like that anymore. All the cucumbers and tomato goodness is now on a bed of boring shredded cabbage, unlike other photos on a bed of greens. So that's a bit disappointing.   Pita was good but seemed store bought instead of home made like Khoury's.   Think we will return because the meats are better than K's.

91FVP8_75nYIc1Yk8PVRNQ.text: My family and I visited this restaurant several times during Ramadan for their Ramadan special. It was 4-course meal with bottled water, (plus dates to break fast!), and it was a phenomenal deal at $15/pp. The food was served pretty quickly, and the bread is always piping hot, and makes a perfect accompaniment with their lentil soup.   We make a point to visit this restaurant regularly for tasty kebab and other Turkish specialties. Don't miss out on the kunefe for dessert!

eSDpR4eZPL4q3MIYmwrHgQ.text: Very nice place so friendly. I love Turkish food ,So delicious. highly recommendable !!!!!

nUBKLgy5iLs_ryRKICszwA.text: I don't like the bait and switch game.   My office ordered lunch from Maza previously. We were accessed a nominal delivery fee as expected.  However on our most recent order we were given our total. When the delivery driver arrives we are given a different total. The higher total is due to an additional delivery charge because the driver said "we are far"   You were given the address on the phone. At that point if you feel we are too far (although it's never been in previous orders) then say that on the phone. You don't just take on additional funds without ever disclosing it.  If we aren't in your normal delivery area then why did you bring your menus to our office complex to begin with. Disclose this on your menu so consumers are aware. Verbally say it in the phone when taking our orders...  Our company will just take our daily business elsewhere..

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Recent receipt showing additional delivery fee for an address within their delivery boundaries.

0OtoNqbTOQ-DNc0w17KSDw.text: Ooooooo everything is delicious!!!!!!!! The kunefe was so crunchy and sweet! The rose tea was delightful and not so overwhelming. I had the chicken kabob plate and the flavors burst right on your tongue. The Turkish version of umami!

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The apple tea here is wonderful!!!!!! Not sweet and not overwhelming at all! Simply perfect to end your meal. The food here was superb!!!!!!

tAn12MobbUOtPM7LUd0_BA.text: The food was great! I really enjoyed it. The bread was terrific and examples of good dishes are the Lentil soup and the Chicken Shawarma sandwich. The sandwiches were supposed to have pickles, but they didn't. All in all I had a great time.

d0Czx14XkyZm6Ger_wKPuA.text: My favorite place to go to for lunch!!! They have a great selection for lunch specials for only $9.95!!! You get to choose a starter dish, an entree, dessert and soda for that price!!! Definitely can't beat that.   My favorite thing to order from here is their chicken Adana. It is so delicious! I love the rice that comes with their dishes and especially the jalapeno. I always ask for extra. Their baklava is amazing as well!!!

1KVxTzOhss6qjZEQgt_1Cw.text: Great food . I just wish they had great service too . Not too busy usually , and still service sucks . I come back for the foods , it's well worth it . The lahmacun is great and also the pides . Worth a try .

FftHbmC0rQhnKTz9YnDLow.text: We ordered the appetizer sampler, lamp chops, mediterranean salad and a gyro. All of the items were fresh, perfect prepared and delicious!!! Also love the attentive service from the staff.   I normally hate Mediterranean food but I have to say this place changed my mind!!! It's probably the best Mediterranean restaurant I've been to in this city.

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkish coffee. Interesting.

o2e8Q2ALXQfYKa8KTDgigA.text: This place is EMPTY on a Saturday afternoon, but despite that, service was friendly and the food was just as described. We ordered an assortment of things from the menu including the lebni which is sort of like a yogurt/cream cheese type flavor with olive oil and spices. I was so happy to see they offered it since it's one of my favorite things to have with pita (or anything else really) but it isn't something you can get everywhere. It was a hit, as was the juicy chicken kebab and the shwarma wrap that was on special. Entree sizes are great for the price (under or around $10). Even the greek salad was big enough to have leftovers. The employees seemed Persian so that added to the authenticity of the food for sure. They also offered us tea at the end of the meal which was a nice treat.   Maza would be a great place to have a large group dinner where you reserve the entire dining room.

xQr9Ts4yrFElD_P267Y06w.text: Excellent food and great service.  It reminds me of Hyderabadi food I had in my childhood.  Guys this is the best food ever in Las Vegas....if you're a desi or non-desi must try their food.

37IqI-oGgFEIhy0RDzd_oA.text: I ran into the Maza Mediterranean Grill Lounge just by either accident or divine intervention. I've never heard of the restaurant before but I  was in the area because I'd just gone to church at the  St. Joseph husband of Mary Catholic Church nearby. I have a chicken shawarma wrap which was phenomenal. The chicken was marinated 6 hours and it was artfully presented with lettuce and tomato. I chose the chopped salad with cucumber and tomato and pickle cabbage, rather than the french fries or the rice- and I'm so happy I did. Everything  was out of this world.   Camille the owner was so friendly, you'll feel like you're at home.  Many of the restaurant selections are very healthy. I will return over and over again.  Paulette Motzko, Food Writer

I had to try and it did not disappoint. Lahmacun, Sigara Boregi, ezme, Iskender, Adana, & Doner kabob. Kofte, lamb chops and list goes on. It's just so good! Got to try the kunefe dessert!!!

xHOh3JIh7W4uOQfPDQA3Gw.text: I have been 3 times , this is really good Mediterranean restaurant. I m waiting next vacation at Las Vegas. I will go to eat there again.

OmzwaemRepKHlzv1BISroQ.text: So, where are all you people?  We just discovered this gem yesterday after reading of it in Yelp, as well as its advertising.  At 5:00 it was about empty and were told it's just a few months old.  I ordered the chicken kabobs which incl. a wonderful full salad, perfect rice, grilled tomato & pita bread ($9.99).  The chicken (& lots of it) was pure melt-in-your-mouth, with just the right herbs.  My partner had the beef Shawarma sandwich which he raved about & which incl. a real variety of goodies, accompanied by a huge plate of non-greasy French fries.  The order of Baba Ghanoush was the best I've had in this town & smoky as it should be.  Maza is a Turkish restaurant & playing THEIR music!  What a change & how terrific the sounds.  Our server, Leila, was most charming & efficient.  We are now making this our weekly stop & I can't wait to try the lentil soup, Baklava, & lots of specialties-- all for a song.    Let's  put Maza on the map of  MUST DINING & fill it up enough for their live music to come.  K I K I

mBRIZwgfP8LtJAiLYROB0A.text: We came here from out of town. We were on the strip and wanted somewhere new to eat. We checked Yelp and we were impressed by the high rating. We all ordered different kabobs and were very disappointed. The meat was dry and portions are very small!

fgbOtvve8nBHtUUC-jniAw.text: Amazing food and great service!!  This place has the best Turkish food in town, although at the beginning I wasn't sure what to order my waitress was very helpful in helping me decide. I recommend this place if you are looking for great Mediterranean food, and a good family atmosphere!

bZF0l3ilHxnyVqG3PXZi9g.text: SO tasty! Their rice alone is amazing, and the meat it comes with is just so good. They brought us tasty chopped salads before the entres. I'm so grateful for this halal option.

kMOI0Bjbb7a73YHOYf897Q.text: I've been here twice now for lunch. Ordered the lentil soup and Mediterranean salad the first time and the Greek salad with chicken the next. Others in my party ordered the chicken kebob lunch specials and a gyro and they looked fantastic.   The lentil soup is different than what I'm used to (more blended consistency) but flavor was great. Both times the salads were lovely - fresh and flavorful. The herb balance with the Mediterranean salad was a standout. Chicken was tender and had good spice blends on it. I think probably the worst thing was the pita. Both times it was thin and dry, maybe over-warmed? Hummus didn't have as strong of a flavor as I'm used to, but maybe I'm just used to over-salted store bought stuff.   Service was great both times. Wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable about most items on the menu. It's not THE best Mediterranean I've had, but it's certainly the best within a mile or two from my work. I'll be back. The quality and experience is worth the (reasonable) price.

79q9nTWdlzZjG7H1uYrx0Q.text: On entering we found this very large restaurant was largely empty early on a  Friday evening.  We started off with the Sultan's Delight appetizer - a generous portion of braised lamb over silky roasted eggplant (babannush?) that we almost finished.  For entrees we shared orders of lamb and chicken skewers which came with jasmine rice, a grilled pepper and tomato,  pita-type bread and side salads.  The chicken was moist and the lamb tasty though more overdone than we generally prefer.

YRI0xf_uc_ZtR_BcecV-4g.text: We found this wonderful place on Yelp tonight as our family was looking for Mediterranean food.  We live very close by and in fact drive by Maza almost daily.  Can not believe how great the food is and that we have never tried going.  We put in an online order, paid online and when we went to pick up the order was ready up front.  As other reviews stated the dining room is very pleasant so next time (soon) we will eat in the restaurant.  We had Chicken Kabobs, both chix breast and an order of ground.  The hummus was very fresh.  Salad crisp and everything was healthy.   Definite good find!

-v-axvy9JqUvAansEE7h-Q.text: My husband just returned from a trip and we wanted to have Middle Eastern food. Maza it was! The decor is "typical tired old restaurant" but clean. Staff are helpful and very pleasant. The appetizer was 4 pieces of flavorful but dense felafel. It was more dense than dry but it was hot at least. Combo kebab platter and chicken kebab were good. The meat was seriously tender. I did not say it was seasoned but it was nicely tender. Rice was good. Tomatoes were undergrilled. There was no grilled onion on the plate. I was sort of lost as the onion should be my companion in every MidEastern meal. We chose to try bakhlava. They serve two pieces on the plate. It was dry and without sufficient honey. Definitely cheaply prepared. My husband's father made home made delicious bakhlava and the version at Maza should not be the reason for your trip over here by any means. The meal was a solid 3. Not bad but not overwhelming. Maybe with a serious chef and reasonable expenditure to primp up that dessert and spring for my stinking onion it could really rock.

zzz78sZ6OMWlwtoMkDSRrQ.text: Amazing and fresh! Baba Ghanoush and Sarma were amazing! We will definitely be back! Oh and the Turkish coffee is on point!

HXBqBLDjt-RG8Z1iUsHC_w.text: Amazing traditional Turkish food. Very friendly and smiling face people. Thank you guys.

NsTLtserd72nfdbtn9swKw.text: I came here for lunch recently after buying their groupon.  I got their mediterranean salad, babaganush, and the combo kabob.  The babaganush came out first. This was the first time I ate this dish, so I didn't know what it was supposed to taste like. I didn't really taste the eggplant but I could taste the garlic and olive oil. I probably won't get this again when I return.  Then came the mediterranean salad. It was the best thing I ate. All of the vegetables were so crisp and fresh, they all had good flavor and the herbs helped brighten all of the flavors of the vegetables further.  The kabob combo was good as well. All of the meat was grilled perfectly and it was all moist. I couldn't really taste the seasoning on any of of the meat. The tatziki sauce and red tomatoe based sauce that came with everything helped add constrasting flavor. The fries were seasoned well, hot, and crisp. The pita bread that came with everything I ordered was soft and warm, with good flavor on it's own. I also got a couple of pieces of baklava for checking into Yelp.  Service was excellent, my drink never went empty, my orders came out correct, and I was given plenty of extra napkins.  The food and service was so good, I ordered another groupon to come again. I'll keep coming as long as they have a groupon, and I would come even without a groupon.

Sz_MM_XHAFmiAw3iigMpEw.text: Great place, loved the food, excellent prices, and huge portions! The baklava is to die for! Totally loved the cup of tea that came with it. Nice touch!!!

Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great appetizer sampler!

f7X7KbOZb_jBr53MRhOvhw.text: This place is fabulous. I have been to Turkey multiple times, and I can attest that the food here is the real deal -- wonderful flavors. I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough.

Pcv2jkimD5coBCvhjJOhRg.text: My G/f and I stopped in here for lunch. We had the ground chicken kebab and the steak kebab both of which we thought were pretty good. In fact the ground chicken kebab was probably the best I've had. I also really liked the hummus and the tomato cucumber salad. They could however ease up on the herbs in this salad but it's pretty good.   The atmosphere is a bit more upscale than you would normally expect for a kebab joint but the cost doesn't really reflect it that much. The service is better than most places I've been with similar food. I really like to support our local businesses in Las Vegas as we are also business owners. I really look forward to going back here for dinner when they add the entertainment and get their liquor license. Food good service good price point is affordable. I think this place will make it and it will be a good spot to spend the evenings. I highly reccomend!

47ec0b2GpaZrcsBbSlORYQ.text: Someone who read my comment may think that I am one of the friends of the restaurant owner. Actually, I am a friend of him now. How this happened?  2 years ago, I came to Vegas for the first time and I was looking a Mediterranean restaurant. I found this restaurant on yelp. It was newly opened but the taste and quality of food was so delicious, so i had all my meals in MAZA during my vacation in Vegas. Also, the owner was so helpful and intimate that he gave information about Vegas, clubs and casinos. He even suggested some other restaurants from other cuisines. After this great taste experience, I came to Vegas 2 more times and on each of my trips, I went to MAZA to have my lunches and dinners. I also took my friends to MAZA, they were amazed by the great taste and hospitality. We were like in our home and had great time in MAZA. On the other hand, the employees are awesome! Jessica, the manager, she was very helpful and hosted perfectly when the Owner, Kamil was not in the restaurant. The cooker, Ege, he is an amazing young guy with great cooking talents. He cooked the kebab exactly as i wanted. The waitress, Lila and Serbian guy, they were smiling intimately, not insincerely. Ibo, the service guy, he even came to talk to us. And Kamil, the owner, he is an awesome, friendly, chatty guy.. I really enjoyed my conversations with him. In my last trip, I saw that they developed their business and they have new dishes in their new menu which the photos of each dishes. Also, the owner brought a another cooker from Turkey and started to serve pide and lahmacun which are my favorite fast food in Turkey and they go further and now they order a stone oven to cook pide and lahmacun.  Lastly, they use Halal meat which is important for me since I care my diet and health so much. Basically, MAZA Restaurant is a perfect place to have Turkish Mediterranean food. When you go there you have not only great food but also perfect friends. I strongly recommend you to go there. I wish they were here in Monterey, CA. Maybe, one day, they will.. ;)

xZ1DfAi90K5z5UHBjOh4qg.text: Anna is amazing. Food was great and service was even better. Will definitely return. Anna gave us amazing recommendations for our meal and pointed out things to try on the next visit.

YWjgSgSHjkzYSSJdPJ6Ggw.text: It's best Mediterranean and Turkish food at town. I been here almost every week and almost 5 star service. They been improving quality and service day by day. Owner and employees are so friendly and their Doner kabob is best all of USA. You must try.

Family friendly ambiance w/entertainment.  Good Greek food too.  Near The Source dispensary.  Portions are generous.  Good bar.

2PauxUIaymFZFUSvAV0Sdw.text: We were pleasantly surprised. The food was authentic Turkish. Everything was delicious.  The staff was welcoming and friendly.

hP3-e6w42l3TDJRkQcpQCQ.text: Great place.   Awesome food  try Adana kabob  And appetizer platter.  Service was really good as well.

9HoEpwTf16xktzmwlPTjhQ.text: Hey guys, a little disappointed on a couple of things and ok with others.   Ordered the chicken shawarma and beef wrap. Both were good. The fries that came with both were cold though (note I ordered from UrberEats, therefore I'd expect them to be cold I guess - even though my house is 6mins from you). Well done on both items not being soggy though.   But wtf is up with the rice pudding? Having had rice pudding from many other Turkish restaurants over the years from all over the world I sort of had the expectation that they are all the same i.e. good. Thing is too, rice pudding ain't too damn hard to get wrong. But look at the picture of what I received... I thought it was melted cheese or something? Then as I realized it was a burnt rice pudding?!? Why is it even burnt? Oh and no cinnamon.   Look I feel silly - which I shouldn't be - complaining about $3.95... but this ain't right you guys. Take it off the menu and don't have this crap available! What's really dodgy here is that I rang you guys too, straight away upon receiving my order to ask what was up and the lady's response was "well they know what they're doing". Well guess what, not with this particular item at this particular time. I mean seriously, look at the picture again and tell me they got this one right. What a waste of time, effort, a few dollars and energy you lot.

z2bTJNLOB1R2xi-TyYudFg.text: We went there on Christmas day . Waiter got us seated right away at 6:20 pm. Then a lady came and told us that they had a very big catering order and they would not be able to serve food before 7:00pm . We ordered food and another guy from the management assured us that we will get our food no later by 7:00 pm. We sat and waited . Around 7:20 I asked the main waiter abt how much more time we need to wait . Very rudely he answered that he is just a waiter and can't take the responsibility of chef being slow . At 7:30 he brought chicken shish kabab , threw it on our table and left . We still had chicken shawarma to come . I asked him that we ordered pita bread to be eaten with shish kabab . He just ignored. I asked him again , a bit louder this time and he shouted that he heard me first time and I didn't need to repeat . My husband asked him to atleast acknowledge that he had heard what we asked for . He came to our table , took shish kabab and said bye bye  " u can leave " . I have never seen such terrible behavior from any server . I understand that they were overworked , stressed as it seems they had taken order greater than their capabilities but such behavior was not justified.  Never going back there and telling everyone I know abt  this as well.

UBedx0fBodOCkTYg6qLoBg.text: Great kabobs and salads. 4 stars only because they were out of lamb when we went. They appetizer platter and bread was delicious to start off with! Would recommend and will be back.

-lK0GRZ3yJwdXtO306EwRg.text: My second time at MAZA in 2 days!   The SEAFOOD KEBAB is my favorite!  It come with SHRIMP & SALMON grilled, a side of veggies, and salad & PITA of course! 51kg66REZl15-RAICaALYw.text: Wasn't impressed. I was craving for Mediterranean food after church and because it was super close to church, we came here for lunch. It wasn't busy so we were seated immediately. The place was dark and in my opinion was unkempt. There were chairs stacked up and stored in random places. It didn't look like they were renovating. Maybe they were just setting up for the day? I don't know. It felt like we were in an abandoned restaurant. Our waiter was friendly but seemed like he was new and didn't know much about the menu. He did refill our water without us asking though so that's always a plus. I ordered my fave, babaganoush as a starter - it was alright. I got seafood plate and the salmon was too dry. My husband didn't enjoy his shawarma, said he's had better. Will I come back? Not too sure.

a1_y-5OhfMoJKRT0rn-OuA.text: Not very impressed. First, it took a while to be seated. Then it took a while to get my order placed. Mind you, the place wasn't very busy. They didn't refill my water or check on me at all. It took a while to be able to alert the server that I would like my check. In fact, the only thing they were fast about was picking up the bill once I signed, which is bad form.  As for the food, well, good food can at least partially redeem lackluster service. This was not particularly good food. At $14 for the Doner plate, considering the average quality of the product, it is about $4 overpriced. I have had considerably better versions of the same dish. The cabbage side was ok, but the salad looked unappealing with non-fresh lettuce etc.  So, definitely thumbs down. Way down. Almost one star down. Very disappointed.

M10hrFIOV7jf5cQC2uz_kA.text: Hands down, the best Mediterranean restaurant in Las Vegas, and most probably, in States!! You do not only taste the amazing Mediterranean and Turkish cuisine here but also experience the unique hospitality of these amazing regions. The restaurant provides variety of top-quality dishes prepared and served in such traditional ways paying full attention to every detail!   Their menu includes dishes ranging from Turkish breakfast to Iskender Doner Kebab, as well as, Lahmacun to variety of Pides. Their desserts such as Kunefe are spectacular! You will see the photos that I took. They speak for themselves! Plus, the restaurant has a gorgeous Mediterranean-style interior-architecture. All menu items I had were very fresh and made from scratch. Restaurant is very clean, and well-organized. All the staff is extremely friendly. Such an excellent level of customer service!!   As reviewing such an excellent restaurant, one has to mention that the restaurant has a chef who aims perfection in his cooking. You can feel, see and taste his unique signature on each dish!   If you want to feel like at a warm Mediterranean home, I highly recommend you this amazing restaurant!!

LEhLwk35KrIN3pQf4sfcJQ.text: Hands down best casual Mediterranean place I have been too. Tried awhile back when I had a Groupon and been hooked ever since.   The chicken kebab is soo tasteful and moist. It's crazy how perfectly cooked it is. Seafood kebab is also very good. I always know when I come to this place the quality will be on point and the value is tremendous. $10.95 for a huge plate of chicken kebab, huge pieces of chicken! Love this place!

sunf5CLJSJuXUiIzKN4wUg.text: Wow. Probably the tastiest kebab I've ever eaten.  The seafood kebab comes with juicy lump of salmon and flavorful grilled shrimp, as well as the shiny grains of rice and grilled tomato and chili. The tomato-based dipping sauce has intricate but not overpowering flavor that complements the simplicity of grilled stuff.  Tried both lamb and beef, and while both were really good, lamb will remain as our fix. Hummus was great, too.  But I cannot end this review without mentioning the most surprising find: Baklava.  Whenever we tried baklava in the past, it was always too sweet to the point that caused a headache. We never liked it. But as this place offered baklava as a check-in bonus, we decided to try on a whim - and glad we did! The baklava had a delicate sweetness and texture, and the flavor of ground pistachio completed the traditional Turkish pastry. Also, we ordered a couple of chai - comes in the traditional cute little cup - at no charge!  One major letdown was that the both times we visited, the table cloth was not clean, and the paper table cover didn't fit with the shape of the table in a booth, and kept making friction noise all the time. Interior design could use some sprucing up.  When those issues are solved, I can give them five stars!

I hope that Las Vegans will frequent this business and help keep it afloat.

-EOZiGnu6942tzglAb9DtQ.text: This is a Great Family Friendly Restaurant with AMAZING FOOD!! Definitely the best lamb chops in town, made perfectly!! We've had the grape leaves, lebni, hummus, baba ghanoush, beef kabobs, chicken kabobs, lamb chops, lentils soup, chicken soup, mushroom soup, traditional Turkish rice pilaf, ALL Amazingly Delicious!! At the end of your meal, have the Turkish coffee with Turkish delights and baklava!! Definitely the most authentic & delicious Mediterranean/Turkish cuisine in Las Vegas! What makes the experience even better, is the friendly service!! Definitely a MUST TRY!! =)

RkzVLi0H_IKN3IZ4QIDbEA.text: We found this restaurant recently after moving to Vegas not too long ago.  We like it very much, good food, good service, and most of all, very reasonable price.  The place is clean and spacious, easy parking.  Highly recommended.

dIC-btKdtt9Cur-KK1BA7w.text: The food was amazing! We came using a Groupon but the food is worth full value. The chicken is tender, shrimp is succulent, and baklava is mouth watering! We don't like tea but their Turkish tea was yummy! Thank you Lilia for wonderful service!

zUur4Th7b7PgxfgPqrnQug.text: Best Mediterranean food I ever tasted.. I used Eat24 app, this restaurant may have a high minimum when you order online but it's worth it!!!

DC7yDz2IhRaZteT_ZmfYWg.text: The food here is amazing!! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Service is excellent!! Can't wait to come back!

wGGO1GPLF8aVwnJDa6eKPg.text: Have to admit that it was a coupon that lured us in. Why will we return again and again? The perfect service, outstanding food, and great menu pricing. Our favorites were the Ikra, Sarma, Tabbouleh, Chicken Shawarma, and Lamb Kabob.

f9wvyFZMDWsJIQnqDfgySw.text: Stopped in for lunch had the maza plate,stuffed eggplant and beef kabob everything was very fresh and delicious We will definitely  be back

VNcaq2Z6GpLFzq1xgmEBtw.text: We ordered from grub hub from Maza.  The delivery was very fast, but the food was awful.  We ordered the fish plate, and it consisted of tuna from a can, imitation crab salad, and lox.  I also ordered a pasta that came with some kind of oil that was inedible.  I have not dined at their restaurant, but do not order their takeout from grub hub.  At this point I am sure that I will not try dining in, as the food was disgusting.

NIE6sAIBi1j_2dMfBUHWtw.text: Came here because of a group on. Never had proper authentic Mediterranean food but my wife wanted to try so why not. First off the proportions they give you are huge! All the food taste very fresh but it's not my palette. The pricing seemed high but good thing I had the group on. If you love this type d food and want to take a date here ten this place is perfect. The staff is very friendly and gives great service!

2TlJlWRIxDyUBOIxHjJd9Q.text: This was our first visit to Maza.  We were trying mediterranean food for the first time and it was quite a pleasant experience.  The hummus was the best along with the fresh hot bread that is comes with.  I was a bit hungry as I had a gryo (fantastic) and the seafood kabob.  My partner had the combo kabob that had beef , chicken and lamb.  The meats were very tasty in that you could tell that they were marinated and not just seasoned on the top of the meat.  We had the baklava for dessert and a surprise of turkish tea with it.  The tea was so good in that it required nothing like lemon or sugar in order to drink it.  We will defintley be back.

IytnGNzwvi3TzjZ_eVsF1g.text: After years of driving by this place I decided to finally give it a try. The fact that the menu had pictures of each item was fantastic and helped me ordered. The food was great  and the service was good.

XlxU3OH5WPBh2jCUMgCrvQ.text: my friends and I came here couple of days ago for dinner.  The menu came with clear photo of the food which I like. They also had finger food like chicken wings. I had the Beef doner kabab, and the beef was done perfectly, it came with salad or you can sub with french fries and side of radish. I like the house sauce that came with it. My friend had Manti which is Turkish handmade ravioli served with garlic yougurt sauce and red topping. That was ok, the ravioli could be done a little more.  My favorite is Karniyarik which is oven roasted eggplant stuffed with ground beef and special herbs, served with tzatziki and rice pilaf.  For desert, Kunefe was excellent, it's made with cheese pastry soaked in sweet, sugar-based syrup, topped with pistachios.  The atmosphere is a bit more upscale and I love the lanterns and aquariums.   The young waitress was very attentive.  The price were affordable. I would like to return. I highly recommend!

iLDSPCWWlf8e-K9gD9DKiQ.text: The foods is very nice. But all about service is very slow when you wanna order or need some think but when you call for check is so fast. Lol. I think the problem is staff not enough for this restaurant. Because I see staff at front just 2 people this time.

xS5mY1fwL9C0xzbCv5VuRw.text: Ordered the knafe to go, when I got home, saw that it was burned and hardly had any cheese Not worth the 13$ I paid for it

9MPkgeGK3YJpJHMyCg65Rg.text: This establishment is very clean and cute inside. The staff is attentive and friendly.  The food was good, I got a shawarma and my husband got kabobs.  I prefer a shawarma sandwich on a pita with fresh ingredients. The lettuce was prepackaged lettuce. It would have been better if it had fresh cut lettuce and tomatoes, with a yogurt cucumber sauce.  The kabobs could have more flavorful.  All the chicken was  moist just missing more flavor. The pita bread was good, I can't say it was freshly made or prepackaged bread.  Over all it wasn't horrible, and the staff being so nice would be the k my reason we would come Back.

p-A87PR93GNuV15mDlyrvg.text: Maza Mediterranean Grille is a sit down restaurant that also delivers. Their food is fresh and homemade and they give you generous portions. If you go before 3 pm you can get their lunch specials which come with a starter, main meal, dessert, and drink for $10.99. The staff were very very friendly and explained some of the foods on the menu I did not know what they were. Great food! I will definitely be back!

eMg9i8wO41gG1id2wb2FFQ.text: The food is just okay here, the quality has gone down. We went for Ramadhan Buffet Dinner and it was just so so. The soup wasn't on a food warmer, it was just on a stainless steel bowl on the table, in other words my lentil soup was warm and not hot, I couldn't have it. Then they no longer have the kudaifa for the buffet and forget about the Turkish tea, the tea tasted like a strong Lipton black tea. We won't be going here again, but if u must, order from the menu and specifically ask for the Turkish tea. Also the servers kept disappearing, we waited a while to be seated and really had to flag someone for refills and requests.

C2oyY1_T7j7gkUbaTzn1Mg.text: We arrived at Maza from a funeral with 80 guests for a pre-ordered lunch to find the restaurant totally unprepared and were told they couldn't accommodate us. The embarrassment they caused us was totally unacceptable. We were left scrambling to find another restaurant which could accommodate such a large group at a moments notice. WE WILL NEVER EAT AT MAZA AGAIN!!!

Cf_AuLTRpDVPpWjMqwwrog.text: Went here today for the first time. Did not have the best experience. We asked the waiter if the falafel sandwich could be made vegan and he said yes. When the sandwich came out it did not have the ingredients he said and it did not taste good. It had a sauce with dairy in it, no hummus and the falafel was not good.

5fsVnkiaPs4xgRM2uaS2oA.text: First of all, when we walked in we had to wait a few minutes to be seated. Paper table cloths. We ordered gyros pita, and beef Doner plate. Gyro is supposed to be served with tsaziki, or however you spell it, this one came with some kind of thousand island dressing. Wasn't that bad, but the meat did not taste at all like gyro is supposed to taste. I had a hard time with the flavor of the meat or let's say the seasoning. I'm from Europe and this is not the way it's served over there. My husband said the same thing. We won't be going back there obviously, also the interior is really old and the blinds are bend from the sun , overall this place needs an overhaul. When we left the waitress didn't even say thanks, she had a little bit of an attitude. Maybe she was just overworked, but that's not really my problem.

nyHwOcfE3_eMH4ioqy788Q.text: Maza is a casual Turkish Mediterranean place with indoor seating. Our overall experience was an extremely long wait, 45 minutes, with mediocre food lacking flavor. The unfiltered city water had more flavor than the food - even though the water should not have flavor! Time to change that water filter.  The ambience is loud even though it was not very busy. The restrooms were clean and open.  Appetizer: Warm Pita Bread and Hummus was very good.  Main Dish  Beef Doner Kebab - mediocre and very lacking of flavor. The rce was fantastic. Salad was filled with mostly hard stems and very little lettuce leaves.  Kofte Kebab - We found out 15 minutes after ordering that they ran out.  Switched to Chicken Shawarma - very disappointing and lacking of flavor.  After the long wait, we skipped any additional drinks and desserts.  Service was friendly, but the lack of hostess and seat yourself only added to the confusion - we had trouble finding a clean table and then waited 10 minutes before we were greeted at the table.   At our departure, our server apologized for the poor service, long wait, and bad food experience, but made no efforts to fix the issue. It is surprising that this restaurant has such high ratings.

r_3G-r9s2v0AiRmJCF5h1Q.text: AMAZING Food... meat was super tender season perfectly... Ivan and All the employees Amazing staff they are sooooooooooo nice to every single person that I see walk in... Will definitely be coming back... Nearly ALL other business should learn from these people... This kind of business is to perfection

qsJiZlKbvapbGpjzUSpmyg.text: Everthing was great all foods are  so tasty  Price is  so  reasonable the best restaurant ever in vegas

rjqxsO5p-VEk6b3dTZ2yfg.text: Pide. Lahmacun. Kebabs. Doner. Fresh Pita. Kunefe. Need I say more?  Maza know's what they're doing! It looks a little rough around the edges (they were repainting the exterior when I went) but the inside dining room is gorgeous! They have three salt water fish tanks (easy entertainment for children) and an area where live music plays on some nights.   I wish I knew the name of the gal that was serving us but the food has taken over my brain. She was awesome! Very attentive to our needs and always made sure we had our glasses filled.  The food was ON POINT. I would describe each item we had but that means this review would be forever long and I'd be repeating myself because everything was PERFECT. The pide was flawlessly soft and the doner was flat out delicious. We had heaping handfuls of leftovers due to their generous portions and our server was so kind to label what each of the boxes contained, so we easily knew how to distribute at the end of the evening.  I don't regret anything I ate, but I'm pretty sure I had a food hangover the next day, so be sure to head over here when you're hungry!

rMK3YxD-JE45bvdWT6pCHw.text: The food we received was fresh and flavorful. Tons of small sides given to you when eating at the restaurant. I just don't understand why this place is not very packed, they have all the elements needed for a packed restaurant, delicious food, good prices and a great indoor vibe.   Nonetheless, I recommend this place anyway

YNBNGqy48dbECZ7L1HRIug.text: Pffft...  If you haven't been here, you're missing out.   Amazing food.  Amazing prices.   An absolute gem.

wmUYzAKhMGUM5ETILA9I_Q.text: Great Turkish food. Having lived in that part of the world, I ate real Turkish and Mediterranean food. This takes me back! Great service too.

MQp49meWztjttLhKfoTomw.text: Mouth watering food. Yummmmm. Will definitely visit again. Got there and was seated immediately. Waitress answered any questions we had about the menu and made some suggestions. I ordered salmon and shrimp. With salad. Wow wow, the food was so well seasoned. My 2yr old is not a big seafood eater, but he ate 3 shrimps and 3/4 salmon. I was in awe. I guess it must have been that good. Wil definitely recommend this place. Good food. Good atmosphere and very reasonable prices. Plus the waitress was very personable.

u2qJl_NsbqnyjtG_73Fnng.text: I've been wanting to try this place since we pass it often to and from work.   While it is labeled as a Mediterranean fare, it seems to be Turkish.  Babaganoush was pretty decent. It was rather creamy so if you like a creamier dip then this might be for you.   Entree meals came with a salad and that came out first in its own bowl. The serving was generous and I like the simple lemon and fresh herbs that make the vinaigrette.   Chicken adana kabob had good flavor and texture. Beef kofta kebob could have been cooked less as it was slightly dry though. There was a side of a ezme sauce which is a tomato pepper salsa of sorts, grilled pepper and tomato, onion slices and a few triangles of pita bread. You get a choice of rice or fries and we got one of each which were both good. Everything was simple fare, but solid.   The baklava was really good. Real buttery, nice syrup and light on spices and served warm. Currently theres a yelp check in for a free square.   Service was friendly. At first we sat around for a long while as the server got tied up on the phone, but after we were checked on in a timely manner. Then a new server started helping and she was super personable as well.    I will be back. It was really reasonably priced, fresh tasting and good portions.

6QyuXumFcCIWouM-qusmNA.text: I have ordered delivery from Maza numerous times and pickup a couple of times.  The food is consistently good, and the portions are huge.  The hummus serving is very generous and I always ask for extra pita to stretch it out.  Today when I ordered they had a new type of pita that was fluffier than normal pita and very tasty.  Their kabobs are very good, I often order sarma, which is well spiced and the entrees come with a nice sized salad.  The only inconsistent thing I've had was the rice pudding.  A couple of times it was mediocre, however today it was deliciously sweet.  I'll keep ordering from this restaurant.

mL9mURkZW6DjCZpp-mPXiA.text: Yesterday i was at the restaurant and we had aproblem in our order. The manager dealt with this problem in a very professional way. I really respect what he did in converting negative experiances to positive ones.

DhkxMWzb5VAWQa-XDgpZ2w.text: Wonderful! First authentic tasting Turkish Adana Kebob. I've been to many in Vegas and most don't live up to real tasting at normal prices. Alex was so nice to us! She was very sweet and gave us complimentary baklava to go!! I will go again. Turkish tea was awesome too!!

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gPYNidbhoDGJJg7kJ458Iw.text: The best mediterranean food in Vegas by so far, hands down. I ordered lamb shank and Mediterranean salad. It was the best lamb shank that I had in Vegas. I would suggest this place to everyone who has good taste for good Mediterranean food. I would defiantly retuning soon.  Thank you

IXjfgXYiaGEIL_GSRe2BNA.text: Another wonderful meal at Maza. I love this place! We used our prix-fixe meal for 2 from Groupon today. The service was exceptional and the food was just ah-mazing! We had the Maza sampler  and for our entrees, we both had the combo Kabob. We should have braced ourselves, I know but the babaganoush, hummus, tabbouleh and sarma were so good we could not stop eating. Add to that the warm pita slices. By the time our entrees came, we were pretty full. The lamb, beef and chicken pieces were so moist, perfectly cooked and seasoned. The last time we were here, the chicken was a little dry, this time everything was cooked perfectIy.  Personally, I still prefer the lamb and beef. It even seems like they gave us more meat or the pieces got bigger. Even the salad was huge. Not complaining though :) . Of course the meal came with baklava for dessert(which we asked to go) and Turkish tea.  We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best kabobs in Vegas.

M1tD3lL2w1o7kxRkUayhDQ.text: Food was amazing. We had the seafood kabob and the lamb kabob, some of the best food we had in Vegas. Get the Groupon for the meza sampler, 2 entrees and 2 baklava pastries. You can't go wrong with coming here unless you really just don't like this type of food, but worth trying.

Wn1v6fB0b4IV--2zjf3aVQ.text: Thank you Yelp reviewers!! My husband and I are visiting Vegas and headed here after reading others' enthusiastic and positive reviews. They were very right. We had the hummus and falafel to start- perfectly made falafel in my opinion- soft on the inside and crispy on the outside, wonderfully seasoned- very good! My husband had the seafood kabob with rice and he loved it at first bite. I had the combo kabob and thought the lamb was the best- tender and seasoned well. We were so full we couldn't try dessert. Our waitress was sweet and attentive. All around we had a great experience here and I would highly recommend others to go!

X9iQX3mtyGKH7AhK8fRoMQ.text: The food took a while to come out despite the fact that the restaurant wasn't too crowded. The service was not the greatest; it seemed like the waiters were running away from you before you could try and ask for anything. However the food itself was delicious. We had a large party and ordered the chicken kebab and lamb kebab as well as the doner kebab all of which were delicious. The falafels were great and so was the hummus and baba ganoush. Would definitely come back despite the mediocre service.

-LQ7yYg03MaqWwbmY2I6NA.text: We were here for lunch one day and really enjoyed it. I had some kind of steak with pita and tzitiki all of it was delicious! I will be back and I would highly recommend it. The only thing that grossed me out was a dead cockroach on the floor in the bathroom.

oju4p3EelNRVmkIvfDcWRA.text: Excellent service and food. We had the Beef Doner and the Beef Shawarma. Nice atmosphere, good ambience. Try it!!

O1fw6wQY9Sn4uoZMbuHTHw.text: I love dining here when I'm in the mood for Turkish. The food is really good and so is the service. Been here a few times and have tried a few dishes. With some it's a hit or a miss but overall the food is good.

cBdQ4g0iXWpdPuYNwsYJFQ.text: We tried Maza Mediterranean on a Weds during lunch.  It was quiet and we weren't expecting much.  I had a craving for chicken skewers so we picked Maza.  We are so glad we stopped by, the chicken skewers were the moist chicken I've ever tasted. The portions are huge and an entree comes with a big bowl of salad. All under $10!  What a deal.  I couldn't believe how great the food tasted and how fresh all the dishes were, it was a great find!  We also had a last minute post - wedding brunch at Maza last Sunday. We called an hour in advance and asked for 2 tables for 30 people!  An hour in advance!! They were able to accommodate us, no problem!  We order a few shared platters and shared family style.  All the dishes were prepared and presented beautifully. Our server was polite and on top of things. Everyone thought the food was amazing. These people come from all over the U.S, Boston, NY, SF, LA - great foodie areas and all said the food was exceptional.    Often times with brunch with a big group, you have to wait either a long time to get a table, reserve months in advance and pay a deposit.  Maza made it so easy to organize a last minute wedding event that didn't cost us and arm and a leg.    Any big group dinners I plan again we will definitely be back at Maza.  I can't wait to visit again!

OjSgKNkR2qeRD0B01DZ4sw.text: The environment is very warm and inviting. The food is delicious and great quality. The service is also wonderful! They're very attentive and helpful. Their Turkish coffee was fantastic! I highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maza&#39;s delicious Turkish coffee

BsXENsWBLNyDaPanSbX2sg.text: We are always looking for a great mediterranean restaurant, we have tried a couple on this side of town and have been disappointed dry overdone and poor wait service.    I was a bit surprised when we walked in and it was pretty bare, but it was a sunday night.  We were seated by a very friendly nice young lady, we later found out was from the Ukraine so some of the food is worded differently and has some difference.  For instance we ordered Sarma is very similar to Dolmades I could tell the difference in texture, Sarma seamed softer more creamy texture, I liked it a lot better then Dolmades!  The next app was Baba Ghanoush it is a cooked eggplant dish similar to a Hummus or a baked artichoke dip without the high fat in artichoke dip.  I loved it creamy soft with lots of flavors and low in fat with a warm soft fresh pita, Soso GOODgood.  The dinner was as good, we opted for the signature burger Maza Burger, I know strange choice but they made it sound so good in the menu and we were not super hungry it just looked good and it was.  It is not the normal burger I think it may have had lamb in it, it was soft and bold in flavor but the softer flavors blended everything together and the spicy sauce made it a great burger.  It also had lettuce, tomato, a pickled something or other it wasn't a pickle but it kind of was a pickle.  I wish I would have asked I will next time I kind of love pickles!   My next visit I am going to get the lamb, i was just not hungry enough this time.  The service was A+ she came back a few times even though it did start to fill up as we ate.  I like how she was proud of her heritage and knowledge of food from her reign to explain small details is great detail.  I was very happy and will be going back, it is close to home and easy to pick up, now if they only had delivery...

CG1TpX8Xg4MHCsirtO98rA.text: Amazing food and really nice service.  You cannot find such high quality Mediterranean food easily.   Iskender and beyti are especially deliciuos with a kunefe as desert at the end.

mVrkoIeQpgKs496w4y4jSw.text: Best bang for your buck lunch . Went here for lunch with my husband, we ordered the chicken Shwarma and chicken kabob . The lunch special is $9.99 and comes with a starter and a dessert . As a starter we both ordered the salad - the veggies were delicious and crispy , the only thing we could say was we wish the dressing had more flavor .. It seemed to be just oil and was missing the vinegar and tartness that is common in Mediterranean salads . Our chicken plates were delicious ! We also upgraded to fries and they were very tasty ! For dessert we ordered the rice pudding & baklava - both came with a delicious Turkish tea to finish it all ... Very delicious deal .   Note : lunch specials end at 3pm !

0KHQtmAPEQzw8v44GjhttQ.text: The food was good. Very small portions though. Completely under staff. Waited so long. And the worst thing was a loud fight in the kitchen that was very bad and awkward and we were shocked

P-uq8SRzxsQH_-mnZ_1iVQ.text: First time eating here for lunch today and ended up loving it.  Lunch specials were an amazing deal and so much food. The staff was very friendly as well.  Happy all my co-workers ended up loving it as well, even though one of them was confused and ended up ordering a head wrap instead of baklava ;-)  we will be back for sure.

hq0zdSoP-1hVrP_3BOtJXw.text: This food is so bomb I had to write a review! I had the seafood kabab and everything was grilled perfectly and the rice is so flavorful! I also got the Sigara Borek and they are so delicious! Sarma was pretty great too. Will def be ordering here again, despite the higher delivery min!

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yummiest yums!

aMYhNFVnvqeuSnQ9Z76yXw.text: I catered from here two days in a row. Consistently great food- chicken kabobs are tender and well-spiced, rice perfect, pita fresh and doesn't stake quickly, and the Mediterranean salad is lightly dressed, light and very tasty! Both clients I catered for asked where the food is from and thoroughly enjoyed. They delivered ahead of schedule and are moderately priced. Highly recommend!

37MbUj_LZGPeLq3_UFqqUQ.text: The Food is GREAT, the price is Fair. The waiter Kosta is so nice and professional  Great place!!

9V_sVkjZr8Mq8nGL-HfLhg.text: Last week we visited Las Vegas with my husband! The last day we wanted to eat Turkish as me and my husband have a lot of passion about our home cooking! Unfortunately I was really disappointed! My husband ate Iskender kebab which tasted completely like tomato paste and I tried doner wrap which tasted nothing! Sorry I don't want to be harsh but as a Turkish the taste of the food that we tried was unacceptable! I ordered a lentil soup but it was completely tasted like tomato soup again! Why because in Turkish cuisine we use tomato paste as our acidity to taste the food! But in this situation the tomato taste had overwhelmed the real taste!   About service; There were 2 waitress and they extremely forgetful! My husband wanted to order extra lavash bread instead pita! (Turks don't have pita bread! It tasteless and so thick) He said they could charge it to the bill! Guess what  the first waitress told us by bringing another pita in the bread basket , " sorry this is the only bread we have" ! She didn't even stop by to explain why! My husband got really upset because we know we just order doner wrap in a lavash bread and they should have more! It's like saying there is no hamburger buns at a hamburger place! We called another waitress! My husband told her we want lavash not pita! Then she had an attitude! We heard she was yelling in the kitchen to the another guy "what can I do they are Turkish and want lavash"  she brought lavash after that but we already were full! The only taste that we like was the maza platter! I would not spend any money here as it doesn't have a real Turkish taste in their foods! I hope they change the chef soon as I don't think it's a Turkish chef!

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Donee wrap! Looks nice but no Doner taste at all!

gvp3LUHcbkKh7_MA89o3wg.text: Came here with a friend for a late, leisurely lunch and we were not disappointed. Had the sampler appetizer of Baba ganoush, hummus, tzatziki and serma. Wonderful and fresh. For entree, I enjoyed the lamb kabob and my fiend had the combo platter of chicken, beef and lamb kabob. The meat was extremely tender and cooked to order. This was accompanied by a delicious shredded salad. Took leftovers home so we could top our meal off with a Turkish coffee and baklava. The service was great and the meal was memorable. We will be back!

70BDMLAIal7sZdcA8480EQ.text: We have been there several times over the last few months. It seems like they're ordering a different quality of food or ingredients than previously. As examples, their french fries, which used to be delicious, are now thin and overly salted, their chicken is not as tender, their feta has a stronger taste, and their Mediterranean salad is not the same. It's almost as if the ratio of their ingredients changed and they no longer cut the tomatoes, cucumbers, and herbs into as small of pieces as before.    Hands-down, we used to absolutely crave and rave about this food. Now, I don't even really want to go. We used to go here once a week, and I probably haven't been there more than three times in the past six months. I don't know what's going on but lots has changed. I've seen the same owner, so that's not it.

She was incredibly sweet, though, and tried to keep up with her guests.  The food was amazing. We were given some great homemade bread to start. I ordered the combination kabob. t52hW8zsv-AE4wICMD5qhQ.text: After a long training session I was tired, and my fridge was completely empty. I was in no mood to go out anywhere, so I stumbled across Maza on DoorDash and it looked solid. The fact I didn't have to move a muscle was a big plus, lol.  I ordered the combo platter that comes with chicken and beef kabob, french fries, pita, onions, roasted tomato, and salad. The delivery was quick and my order came as requested. The portion size was reasonable for the price, and they also packed utensils and condiments.  However, it wasn't a great meal. They put everything in a Styrofoam box, so the french fries were completely soggy (I wish more restaurants would use paper bags for fried foods that allows foods to stay crispy). The beef was over cooked to well done (site says they do medium well).   Flavors were good, but overall I would say it is just average. I was hoping for a more exceptional meal.

Onions, mushrooms, eggplant, and peppers on a bed of rice pilaf, yum!!   I will definitely be back. I read another review which says they have lunch specials during the week for under 10 bucks.

I really like this joint and heartily recommend it.   The only ding I can place against Maza is it isn't magically appearing right now in front of me.
