Ht-xBbXZpQ9WxtXMAeMwlQ.text: I had the best hour of my life, outside of worship, here. I rarely have a nice dining experience due to frequenting restaurants located inside casinos. Or perhaps, the food is amazing, but, the location is humble. Nothing wrong with either, but, I was able to focus on my experience without putting money into slot machines or hearing the cook help his daughter with math.   I ordered a Turkish coffee, hummus, the lamb chops, and their baklava.   My nice waiter, I saw his name on the receipt, sorry I forgot his name. Brought me the coffee in what has to be the most regal cup I have ever used. He warned me that I would not be able to sleep tonight; and to just go clubbing. lol. It was very strong, no sweetness, but, fragrant and clean in taste. Not like any espresso or Cuban coffee I have had before.   When my dear friend came back and asked my opinion on the coffee, he asked me if I would also like bread and butter. He returned with my hummus and a basket full of warm bread. At this point, I decided to use my best dinner manners as it was obvious that Maza is a restaurant above the rest. The hummus was okay at first, but, as it came to room temperature it released a floral of flavors that were complementary to the artisanal bread. My waiter brought me a tasty salad too. I may have gotten the name wrong, I'm somewhat deaf. It was very refreshing, but, a bit too much vinegar for my taste.   I am not kidding, I was going over my review in my mind as I was digging into the hummus when my lamb chops arrived. The grilled aroma hit me like a burnt offering of ancient times. Oh my goodness! I was having a meal prepared by father Abraham for G d himself. Was I at the wrong table?  The lamb chops were tenderlicious and full of flavor. It came with the most delicious rice, yeah, better than mom's rice. Thinly sliced red onion was served as garnish; I passed as they were a little too strong. They also provide a sauce for the meat. It was interesting and almost from a ketchup base. I used it with the bread as the lamb chops were $$$ perfectly cooked lamb chops. (Minus the extensive wine list restaurant) What a treat!  Can this get any better? F yeah! The baklava was incredible at which point I had to leave and start writing my review. Mom joining the choir was the best thing ever for me. Thank goodness, her practice takes place a block from here. Yay me!

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely the best Baklava I have eaten. Perhaps it&#39;s been awhile,but, it was yummy good.

iXcbH7LxkCdwXUzrek_ccw.text: The food is good...I'll give them that. However, the service is another story.   My husband and I arrived and ordered falafel, salad, hummus, and kabob. Another couple arrives (after we placed our order) and gives their order to the waitress. There is only one other table in the restaurant. Several minutes later, the couple that came after us gets their food. We are just sitting at looking at the waitress and she doesn't even pay attention to us. Finally after 5 minutes she walks over and we ask what happened with our food? She says she will check and comes back to say there was a mix up in the kitchen and our food will be out soon.   In short, we waited about 40 minutes to get our food. No apologies/nothing done to make it right. So while the food was good, service matters a great deal and we won't be back.

H3hrOWe4XPjXjYaPjot3_w.text: Huseyin is the best chief in the town. His kabobs and Iskender unbelievably delicious! As a professional chef, not only his food as good, his personality as good as his food. I will give five star to this business because of  Huseyin. I will see you soon super chef!

gAbFKHAFb34PZ707DNxRug.text: I haven't such a good beef kabob! It makes me want to try the lamb next. Many restaurants serve a slightly tougher cut making it a little chewier. I was very impressed with it. It was the highlight of the meal.   The next best dish was an appetizer, the falafel. All too many times, falafel is over seasoned with salt, leaving me crave glasses of water for hours later after the meal. This wasn't too bad, and it was served with fresh tasting hummus. To me, this would be an appetizer I'd love to have the next time I visit.  The third dish was something I haven't had before, the Pida, a flat bread with mozzarella, although there are other topping options. I liked the taste of the freshness of the cheese and the drizzle of olive oil.  The side salad was interesting. Having the familiar ingredients that I've had at other Mediterranean or Middle Eastern restaurants like cucumber, tomato, and vinegar, it was also sprinkled with a spice mix similar to Tajin... Maybe it's just something new to me, but it's not something driving the meal.  I would certainly have the beef, again, the chicken was good, but not the highlight. I'd love to see how the lamb is prepared!

The Hummus, Falafal and Baba Ganoush (the kind w/yogurt) were all quite tasty. I almost forgot that we were also given a salad at the beginning of the meal. So, if you're really hungry or looking for some good fresh cooked food. This is the place to go. For the entrees, we both got the combo kabob platter which was perfectly marinated and the meats were so tender and juicy and the vermicelli rice that came with it was delicious, as well (salad was okay). The food overall felt authentic. I usually don't care enough about places to write reviews because A) I am selfish and just care about putting food in my mouth and B) most places are MEH. But this place has only been open for two weeks and I am so glad that it did and hope it gets busy and stays open!

I ordered the cheese plate and there were NO nuts, NO fruit, NO crackers and only the feta cheese.. I do not even know what to say to that. That is just pure laziness and expecting a customer who ordered out not to notice? There was no gouda or english cheddar and it was filled with green onion and what looked like parsley... That is NOT what is listed on your menu. The chicken kabob was ok, but they served it with rice instead of the fries I asked for. I declined the Jasmine rice or french fry options so Lilly offered to make mine double-salads (ie  more salad in lieu of the rice/fries), which was perfect.  I enjoyed the salads and the chicken kebab portion was good.  I loved the beef & lamb kebab portions and the lamb chops.  I don't know how those meats were so tender (via food supplier and/or cooking methods) and they were delicious.   - Lilly kept my ice water (free) and Diet Coke ($2 and free refills) topped off and checked on me even when two lunch parties (a couple and a group of 5) arrived to the restaurant.  Place was empty when I first got there at noon, but they had tons of reservations for that night. - Place is nice, wood(looking) flooring, table linen, cool table lighting mini-chandeliers(?), etc.  Bonus: at the end of my meal I got a free cup of Turkish hot tea.  Unsweetened, exactly the way I like my tea. - Looking forward to coming back.

zCuGjZLUNh8gm2woKRU5lg.text: This place is a pretty good establishment and the atmosphere was pretty nice especially with the Live Singer singing in different languages, it was pretty cool!  The salads they bring were really good and we also had an appetizer of Pickled Mixed Vegetables which definitely lived up to their name. The main Entree that me and my guest both had was the Chicken Kabob, she had it with rice and I had it with french fries. The meat was served with seasoned tortillas with red sauce, a whole baby tomato, and a whole jalapeno pepper to really spice things up! The service was Excellent from the hostess and the waitress. They did regular checks on us to make sure all was OK and they even had good suggestions on the menu items. They even had chicken fingers and chicken wings for those that aren't to into Mediterranean foods or kids. We finished up with some dessert so we chose the Baklava that was served with Turkish Tea and that was Delicious!!! Everything was great, the presentation of all the food was Excellent and I would recommend this great eating establishment to anyone, especially if you like Mediterranean foods.

Kh27x8drLgJsgyut5_Vjjg.text: When it comes to chicken kabob, yes this is as good as it gets!   FYI: My review will solely be based on their kabobs.  For $10 - $13, you'll receive a side salad or fries, rice, meat of your choice, a grilled tomato and pepper, and pita bread. At most Mediterranean restaurants, I'll go with the beef adana (long, hand-minced meat kebab mounted on a wide iron skewer and grilled) cause it's the safest and pretty consistent at every restaurant. I don't like to go for the regular kebabs because they're usually dried out or over cooked. Maza is the first to prove my kebab assumption to be wrong.   My first time at Maza, I was on my no carb diet and I wanted to be healthy so I went with the chicken option with no rice and extra salad..a very unexciting meal in my opinion. My friend chose the rice option and I was instantly salivating when they brought it out. They provide a Lebanese style rice with cut bits of vermicelli mixed in - very similar to a rice-a-roni mix. Now as for the chicken, if you know me well, you know that I NEVER order chicken at restaurants because people always like to overcook chicken and dry it out, and I'm not a fan of white meat. However, at Maza I was happily surprised that the chicken is like what Sheila G. said, "BUTTAH." I hate this word but it must also be said, the chicken was sooo MOIST. It's the only thing I order here now. I microwaved the leftovers two days after and you know how sometimes when you microwave meat it just gets tougher cause you're basically cooking it again? NOPE not with this chicken! It stayed tender and just as good as the first night.  I've ordered the lamb kebab, beef, the beef adana, and they're all good as well, however my top choices are the regular lamb and chicken (obviously). The beef wasn't as tender, so if you don't mind gaminess... go for the lamb!  Bonus star: I live near trop and 215 and they were still willing to deliver to me!

aO3Wv6dJ0w1DSzfKQYxnhg.text: Went here with one of my best friends, who is from Ankara, Turkey.  I spent some time in Turkey as well so we were both excited to have Turkish food in Vegas finally....since it's our favorite.  Her boyfriend joined us as a first-timer for this cuisine.  We ordered three entrees, the Manti (Turkish Ravioli), Iskender Kebab and the white beans with meat (forgot the name).  We had lentil soup and the choban salad as appetizers and then for dessert, turkish tea, kunefe and baklava.  Almost all was fantastic; my friends stated that the baklava was the only weak part of the meal.  Her boyfriend loved all the food, even as a first timer and one who grew up with a very American diet.  She stated they plan to come here every week now.  I'll definitely be back as well.  Service was fine; nothing extraordinary and never got a refill on our waters....but the meal was what shined.

8yv4PugFwtL9Gx10qXNvWg.text: Good food and good service! Came here with a groupon and the family and was not disappointed! Tr kebabs were grilled perfectly and the side dishes that the entrees came with were great. The salad was cool and refreshing. We will be back for sure.

They give you free Turkish tea afterwards and we will definitely be back soon for more food and fun!

_WzQIEBUrUL1P_IMxE83xA.text: This place is delicious! I always go for the beef kofta. It's like ground beef shaped into little balls. Comes with rice and salad and grilled tomato and peppers. Also the baba ganoush is amazing! There is a dessert that is like a pastry with honey and cheese which comes warm and it's definitely a must try! Otherwise the baklava is always a good choice and made in house! Not to mention the great service! There are great lunch specials and really good Turkish coffee. Everyone is extremely friendly and helpful it's like a family owned business. Definitely a hidden gym in Vegas if you're looking for a yummy authentic Mediterranean/Turkish food spot.

b_YZynxp4ZFUxcfKkTpOcA.text: This is one of my parents' favorite restaurants. I've been here three times in 2 months. We bought the meal- which included salad, a generous spread of pita bread, hummus, baba ganoush, muhamarrah, tzatziki, stuffed grape leaves. The muhamarrah was the best I've ever had! Next was the main course of rice, red onion pickles and kabob. The steak and chicken kabobs were cooked perfectly.   Meal ends with hot tea and baklava with pistachios.   There's so much food you'll be sure to take some home. It's quite a feast!   Tip- ask the server politely to make sure the meats aren't overcooked. The second time we came here the meats were slightly overcooked.   This is a family owned restaurant. When we were here they didn't serve alcohol, but call and ask. Perhaps you can byo.   Tonight, there's a singer on stage - lots of dancing and fun Turkish music. It's like a party here tonight!

D7yAfWPVJFdMLCKTPLEWig.text: Last three times I came here I was disappointed so I really don't know why I decided to give it another try, wishful thinking I guess.  The lentil soup was too salty but not so bad. I had the Adana Kebab. It had no flavor, tasted like kofte more than it did kebab. My husband had chicken kebab, didn't have any flavor to it either. They never brought us side salad that we were supposed to get with our meal. We actually ordered coban salad, they never brought that to us either. When I reminded the waitress that we had ordered salad, she offered to bring it but we were almost done with our meal so I didn't want a whole salad. I was still super hungry since the meal wasn't good at all so I asked if she could bring me a small coban salad. She said she can bring a small house salad (that we were supposed to have gotten anyway) The salad she brought tasted like wet lettuce. It was so bad. I asked for some dressing thinking it'll help with the taste, the dressing she brought us was just oil. So, all in all everything we ordered was HORRIBLE. There were only 4 other small tables occupied with 3 waiters/waitresses working so there is NO excuse for the bad service. It's safe to say, I will definitely not be going back. Do yourself a favor and just order some Pizza Hut or something.

72CeAQPVJ9jDUw3c5n401Q.text: I know my Mediterranean food (Thanks to living considerable time in Petersen, NJ) and Maza food at the best was mediocre. We ordered couple of Combo Kabob & The food was flame burnt to give cooked look but lamb and chicken cube was absolutely not cooked at all in middle.  I prefer my meat medium to medium rare but both chicken and lamb were rushed fast flame broiled (dont know why, most of resturant was empty anyway).  To tip the experience off, they ring "automatic" 20% gratuity for a food which we didn't enjoy eating. Mind it, it was party of 2 and never I experience that you get to charge 20% gratuity on 2 people. I know it's groupon and supposed to be saving so shouldn't be big deal to pass it on to them, but tip is prerogative of customer based on service / food & I absolutely dont feel like tipping them 20% for this calibre of food.  I do not recommend this place to anyone; you are better off trying less expensive yet better food option in this cuisine type.

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 20% gratuity on party of 2 for food which was not even cooked...No thank you...Not going to waste my time or money here ever again!!!

MU38k-rULjwXmLrJD0ME8w.text: The food here is delicious. I tried two entrees, one was the combo kabob and the other was the lamb shank. Both were really tasty and the lamb shank was so tender.  The only reason I took one star off was for the service. The service is slow and could be better.

UCd3-Y373CUsorMzqe2Mog.text: Saturday night and this joint was jumping.  There were three large groups holding forth, several other tables were occupied, and three more tables filled up just after us.  It's a big place, so there were still tables to be had, but the blaring music presented by a guy who was part DJ, part singer, and fully master of none :) added to the frenzy of activity.  The music - some Turkish, some American - was sometimes too loud, but not always.  Hubby went in first, but I lagged behind to take in the cold night air for a bit.  Before I could even open the menu, the waitress came to take our order, and of course I wasn't ready.  She attentively returned a couple more times, and then as soon as we gave our order she said she'd be right back with our salads.  That didn't happen.  We waited and waited while the three tables were served their appetizers (we're not big eaters, so we didn't order appys), then their main courses.    I could have been nursing my glass of wine, but we didn't have any.  Though I had read the Yelp reviews earlier and knew that it was BYOB, I forgot to take a bottle with us, so it was a dry dinner.  I could have been munching on the pita, but we didn't get that until the salads came.  They finally arrived after we asked the waitress to bring them.  In an uncharacteristic move, we both ordered the combo kebab platter, both of which came with salads served before the main course.  That was nice, since it was a larger portion than many Mediterranean places that put it on the plate with the entree.  The light and lemony dressing was nice, not overpoweringly acidic.  What I didn't like was the iceberg lettuce; romaine would have been so much more interesting and tasty.  The kebabs were wonderful.  The chicken was like buttah, so tender and juicy.  My first piece of the beef wasn't as tender, but all the others were, including the lamb.  I liked the interesting touch of the little cup of red salsa (is that the ezme?) served along with the kebabs, which added a little kick, and would have appreciated a small cup of lebni, the strained yogurt that other middle eastern restaurants often include. But that seemed to be available only as an appetizer.  The rice was perfect.  Only the pita was a disappointment, okay when first put on the table, but then dried-out, too chewy, and tasteless.   We took advantage of the Yelp-baklava offer.  While I'm not usually a big lover of baklava, this one was excellent.  And the small cup of Turkish tea we were served at the end was a very nice and welcome touch.   Despite the amount of time we had to wait to fill our stomachs, the food was delicious:  well-prepared, not oversalted, and the portions well-sized.  We will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner Salad

T8Aq1pu0AtqjQ3egeF8sRg.text: Sorry read all the reviews and was excited to come here, my husband has years of experience in the food service industry/management. The gentleman that sat us was very polite, he asked if it was our 1st time dining here which we said yes, he said "it is the best, the rice is the best, you will love it!" Excited I ordered the lentil soup, the eggplant caviar, and my husband also ordered the cheese platter, ordered Turkish coffee as well & Perrier. Eggplant caviar was delicious! Unfortunately I'm used to my lentil soup w/ lentils, this was served lukewarm & pureed, it was ok, forget the cheese platter it's a few slices of feta cheese & food for a rabbit. I ordered the prime beef kabob which was good but I don't understand why he said the rice was so delicious, it was plain rice, no seasoning, my husband also ordered the beef doner platter which was good but not to die for. So all in all the food was not bad. But we ordered 2 more Turkish coffees a regular Kunefe dessert w/ ice cream, the waitress was in such a hurry she served our coffees first which we like w/ dessert, when we got the kunefe it was burnt at the edges, she forgot our ice cream. The real reason I'm leaving 3 stars was when she returned w/ the ice cream she was busy on the phone, served the ice cream over the railing which is a big no no in the service industry, dropped it & spilled it getting all over on my husband's arm's, quick sorry that was it no warm wash cloth to clean his arm. Then we got the bill and luckily my husband noticed she charged us for a large kunefe on top of what we ordered, her explanation was I knew it was either you or the other table, without bothering to ask as I normally don't go over the check w/ a fine toothed comb. Seriously poor customer service and mediocre food, I would pick Khoury's hands down then this place!

EUshvaYOrJ_s0mAGyoijRA.text: For a restaurant that was half empty on Valentine's Day , my first time here,  the service was OK but myself , my wife and 2 other couples felt that we were being rushed from dish to dish , hadn't even finished one dish when they were bringing another, sometimes overlapping , not that it was necessary because they needed the table, place was only half full at best not to mention some of the food offered was not up to par , the bread took too long to get to us , the sea food plate was dry , the shrimp was soggy , that's what you get when u order seafood in a beef and lamb place and to top it all off nowhere does it say it but you get the unpleasant surprise that they do not have even a beer and wine  license , the server when asked said " Bring your own booze and if it's wine they won't charge corkage fees, that takes some nerve. Bottom line all 3 couples won't be going back there again

ozds-1mVDQgNsduNU-RGag.text: Lots of Mediterranean places have popped up in this space: Opa, Plaka, and now Maza. New ownership, interior has had a face lift, cool bar area but no alcohol available yet. Menu mentions $7 lunch specials but I did not see any advertised.   Ordered the chicken shwarma sandwich with rice, $10- hostess/server gave me a heads up that the dish "isn't really a shwarma, it's made in a pan". Decided to give it a try anyway, and the meat and seasonings are okay but it was served, inexplicably, in a giant hoagie bun. When I am at a Mediterranean restaurant, I expect a sandwich to come on pita or lavash, this bun was way too much bread!  The meat was of okay quality but sandwich was not served with any sort of sauce, just peppers, onions, and tomato, which gave the dish almost a fajita feel. Option of rice or fries for my side, picked the rice, which was warm and soft, but after eating the sandwich breading, I couldn't take any more carbs.  Note that they have discount deals up on Yelp and Groupon, and a Yelp check in offer for a free piece of baklava, which was honored even for my take-out order.

OaXxadv2gWkt_PaLhQ78wA.text: Possibly one of the worst outing experience I have endured. The food was mediocre, nothing special to rave about. The falafels were horrible and their tahini sauce is straight out of a can. Nothing authentic about that. The rest of the food we ordered was edible but again nothing special. The worst part of the evening was the service at this place. Our waitress spoke very little English, nothing wrong with that unless they assume a plate of kabob was ordered with a kafta plate. When I kindly said I only ordered a kafta plate, I was scolded by her and the unprofessional manager that is running this place. Never again will I step foot at meza grille. It's advertised under a different light than what it really is. Avoid this place unless you enjoy being talked down to while eating cardboard falafels.

SdsjZdugSpCI6Y5aipMUnA.text: Excellent and friendly service.Amazing taste.Fast delivery.Make sure try Adana.

yPW7D2HEzJ-_I2gh8pZbLA.text: Not so good.   The falafel was pasty. Humus was decent.  I ordered the lamb shank thinking it would be tender and juicy,  braised all day in a special sauce.  Boy was I wrong.  It was so dried out and had lost all it's flavor.  The left overs will feed my puppy. Spend your money somewhere else.

qZLfJgmVG1uVhDOjHHnw5Q.text: My office has ordered from this place before and the food was pretty good, so myself and another coworker decided to order again. I called in to have it delivered and I was first told that they don't deliver over this way because it's too far...I assured the person I was speaking with that they've delivered to this office before, and after giving her the actual address, as opposed to just the cross streets she asked me for, sure enough my office was in their system...so I place the order, and was told the price....it was sort of high for 2 things that should have come to a touch over $20 but I figured that there was a delivery charge even though I wasn't told there was, nor is it written anywhere on the menu, but I'm no stranger to takeout....  I was told it would be about 45 min, which usually means an hour, and that's right around the time it came, so no worries there.....however when I go to pay, the price has gone up since I placed the order! Really?! I told the delivery person the price I was quoted, and she said they charged extra because it was further.  Um who does that? Who charges someone without telling them? I expected the first charge, but a second at the door? To a place you've delivered to before? Not to mention that they were the ones that brought the menu to us in the first place?! Yeah, ok....last time.

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really? An extra $2 on top of the $3 that I wasn&#39;t told about? It&#39;s not the amount it&#39;s the principle.

7lU_6B_0_4Ut4MU_mZqicA.text: Very delicious. Had the prime beef skewers with the Hummus which tasted real good. Nice mellow atmosphere and the service was good. Tall younger server had some nice suggestions for us. Cannot wait to try again in the future. Ate there and is good to go as well. Give them a try!

cw6RoqT6Htp9FsLxR11mFg.text: We came to Maza on a Groupon. Wow was it worth it!  Fantastic baba ghanoush, and hummus. My husband says the stuffed grape leaves are the best he's ever had. The food was well spiced, but not spicy. The meat was very tender and flavorful. This food is simple yet very satisfying. Just looking at the plate made me feel healthy and happy.  We are looking forward to coming back and bringing anyone that loves good food!  Have read some negative reviews and don't know where they are coming from. We were very well treated by both our server and waitress and the food was really good. Maza is a great place.

kRlnf1MfzCL0Ebx_BfvHQg.text: Nice Turkish restaurant with great food. If you come here during lunch time, you get a great deal for $9.99. It includes starter, entree, dessert, and Turkish tea. I tried authentic Turkish dishes and they were great. For lunch I had Hamburger, that was great too. Very friendly timely service by Alex. Recommended.

2fg2ZFMfbmXWqnHwO0gm0Q.text: Extremely expensive. Me, my hubby and 2 toddlers ate for $64 and my kids only ate plain side order of rice(they r picky). Very small portions compare to what we get in Los angeles. So basically for just 2 people they charged automatic gratuity of $8.94. We also got one small knafah (dessert) n the lady offered to add kaymak cream n ended up charging us $3 for half a teaspoon of that cream. I mean i would love to tip but don't make me do it! And let me tell you how nasty the bathrooms were i had to hold my pee until we got to our hotel room. The toilets had poo n period all over. I wish i took a picture (ughhh). Please pay someone to clean your toilets from the automatic gratuity you've been charging. NEVER EVER COMING BACK!

photos.caption: Photo of Maza Mediterranean & Turkish Grill - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small knafeh for almost 10 bucks n automatic gratuity of almost $9 for 2 adults n 2 toddlers. Smh

KkT7yUxVqsXAXuIs9Po-fg.text: The best Chicken kabobs, rice and salad. The food is always fresh, hot and the servers are friendly and willing to please. They have a great Groupon offer.

10I1xKBjznzjtoJUwOunqA.text: I love this place. All of the eggplant dishes are delicious. So are the kabobs. The food comes out hot and fresh. I love this place. The Kings Delight is my favorite (I think that's why it's called) .

EPaBovOabyPTspyAHTy_4A.text: The food was authentic, delicious, and the service was wonderful. Lilia paid very close attention to our needs throughout the meal. After the meal, we were served complimentary Turkish tea. I would love to come back to this place after the wonderful first experience.

1NoHCjclpaJwZD4iYnkypg.text: Amazing food. If you are new to Mediterranean cuisine I recommend asking Anna the server. She was amazing and went out of her way to make it a memorable meal. Her knowledge of the cuisine is extensive.

R9B3lHPDmMUWXUFedG_TYQ.text: I loooooooved this place! Found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try! I'm Iranian and very critical of any kind of kabobs but I have to say this place is amazing! The meat was very tender and delicious and comes with a good size salad!   Turkish coffee was really good   Also loved that they had complementary Turkish coffee to try after the meal!

C6RR3wNjM1AdmEUGCHfYOQ.text: Authentic. Hummus, bread and lentil soup were delicious! The eggplant and meat appetizer (don't remember the name) also delicious.  Our salad might have been missing some seasoning or dressing. Eggplant with ground beef entree seemed to lack flavor.

i82mRsLd4p_7hnqfYaNGoQ.text: The best Turkish food I have ever had.. Their chicken Adana is amazing.. Try their lunch specials-So good :)

SN-6KxGz2nZ_wyj80Q_-vw.text: Amazing food and service. The waitress was really hospitable and we even got a free baklava. Loved it. The best Mediterranean food I ever had.

MRLSXh1IPHaQ3BQ6mOxShg.text: This place is a gem. Good size portions at a very reasonable  price. I had the chicken and beef  kabob and they are both adequately seasoned and tender. I will definitely  come back to this place.  Don't  forget dessert. The kunefe is to die for. Geat service as well.

S1j1esfvvGvH6D0MRnerrA.text: Just discovered this gem! We've read great reviews but originally heard about it through word of mouth and it met all of our expectations. A romantic and comfortable atmosphere paired with amazing food is not easy to find, so we're glad we found this. Iskender was delicious. Try Kunefe with vanilla ice cream.

vvKVZobcKv0przTfqenEwQ.text: We dined at Maza restaurant two weeks ago. We were a party of 9. We arrived 45 minutes before closing. Our host, Ana, was very nice, friendly, and professional. She went above and beyond to provide us with the best service, and the most pleasant experience. The food was extremely delicious. There Kinafeh was out of this world. The food preparation time between appetizers and entrees was quick. I loved the place, I recommend it, and it will definitely be at the top of my list when I visit Las Vegas again. Their food took me back to the good old lebanese days ;)

nREO_82kiujh8cQyZcmf2w.text: Great food! Their rice and chicken kabob were excellent! I love that they serve Turkish coffee in actual Turkish coffee cups. This is a great place to eat and the prices were very reasonable. The service was friendly and accommodating and the owner even came by and chatted with us for several minutes. I will definitely be back and will recommend Maza to my friends.

rgGGIuL1-Tej5nRw1SQ4Eg.text: We went tonight with another couple and had a Groupon for two. We supplemented our meal for two with a delicious salad and incredible fries - more than enough for the 4 of us. The food was AMAZING, the portions generous, and the staff were so incredibly friendly. They were swamped and the staff was limited, but they made sure we had what we needed. Will definitely return!

2DhUCFBDObjESBTILCff9g.text: It's one of the best restaurants here in the valley. A must try for all Mediterranean food lovers  good service as well.

SvUWTs2VRoP6da4Slb84SQ.text: Went in for the first time for lunch. Clean and comfortable. Respectable number of patrons so figure its good. Service is friendly but a bit slow for lunch crowd that needs to get back to work.  White bean stew was good and hummus was really good and very fresh tasting. Made me eat more bread than I should.

3YHbwy238RqF9sivGLZEnQ.text: I super like this place. I bought a deal on groupon. It was so worth it with the amount of food plus free baklava that we got, also the Turkish coffee was awesome. And the girl that helped us was not only strikingly beautiful but very very nice, helpful and informative.

r9k5JoFW0RVZpn4gG_rGnA.text: Great food, excellent service the owner makes you feel at home. My favorite is the lamb chops and chicken and beef adana kabob..yummy

szTEIVhgWyDdCpqPsn_xgQ.text: My boyfriend and I stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner. The food was really good and Alex was very friendly and nice. We were the only ones in the restaurant when we popped in and we remained the only ones for a decent portion of our time there. We liked that it was quiet and I enjoyed the music they had playing. We had the Falafel, Mediterranean Salad, Hummus, and Grilled Vegetarian Salad. We both really liked that the falafel were warm, and the eggplant spread it sat on was cold. The Mediterranean salad was very good! Unfortunately, our mouths are particularly sensitive to vinegar-y food, so we were not able to fully enjoy it. The grilled vegetarian salad was really good with the pita bread. I didn't have much of the hummus, but we are taking it home, and you simply can't go wrong with hummus.  Alex mentioned to us to check in on yelp to get the free baklava dessert, and it was not a mistake. Absolutely loved it, and ordered a cup of american coffee to go with. Went perfectly together, and was a great end to the dinner.  Unfortunately, there were not many vegetarian options. I would love to come back to see a wider variety for those who do not eat meat.  My boyfriend had some sun shining in his eyes through the window, so he stood up to close the blinds. In doing so, he hit his head on the hanging light. The glass shade ended up popping off and falling to the ground. Thankfully, it didn't break. The servers said it was okay and fixed it. My boyfriend was laughing, but we were both pretty embarrassed. Alex ended up shutting the shade for us, and told us a story about another customer who had an issue with the sunshade as well. I am glad they were understanding. So overall, 4/5 for the friendly and great service, tasty food, and light and quiet atmosphere,  but not very wide variety for vegetarians.

FstQ4Z7bypT5bG0dqTC3aw.text: Loved the decor of the restaurant, a quaint place away from the strip. The overall experience was positive, pleasant attentive servers and excellent  Food. We had the kabob sampler (chicken, beef and lamb) and the seafood kabob (salmon and shrimp), the chicken was juicy and delicious and the salmon was prepared perfectly. To finish the meal we had cheesecake and rice pudding, the rice pudding is worthy of return trip. Would highly recommend.

FV0bizYnUtS1B0A90rMkEg.text: One of the best HALAL places i ever ate in vegas, people here are so welcoming, Experience is amazing. I totally recommend it.

_uPrPBDg4k4IowRSdrxWIA.text: This place is my new favorite restaurant. The food was excellent, great service and very pretty inside. The kabobs and rice are the bomb. Please try it out, you will not be disappointed.

6xcNhUwMJQuw5VuPfJZyBg.text: Just got lentil soup and iskender kebab. They were very delicious. They also started serving Kunefe and Sigara borek. If you like any of those you may consider revisiting soon.

H6wfNYqPfJepS9STE1uGBA.text: The food is full of flavor and amazingly good! We ordered the falafel and hummus for appetizers and the combo kabob and the rack of lamb for dinner. The waitress gave great service and filled our drinks. Come here if you want a taste for the Mediterranean!

rW4ykMBI6psBRAC5fcKp1w.text: Maza is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. Maza offers authentic Turkish and mediterranean dishes. I recommed trying doner-iskender, lahmacun, and pide-Turkish pizza.

GI9CBGeLA_pLEcwp3yA_jQ.text: I've had a lot of Turkish food that was really middle eastern food so I wasnt sure and my expectations were that it would be middle eastern. I ordered sarma, which most people know as dolma, they were delicious! Very authentic AND Turkish for sure. All the food to follow was very good.   As a visitor I would have to say that The area is not a great location but dont let that stop you, it is worth the drive from the strip! The staff who served us were friendly and the food was very good!
